color chain 42 place a sm every 14th st fo and put aside chain 42 place a sm every 14th st do not fo pull loop loose pull your loop loose and remove the hook using a sm clip your last chain into one of the marked sts of round 4 follow the photos for placement of all the points of the hexagram and pin the points into place when placing the lines on the 2nd triangle weave the chain over the 1st intersecting line and under the 2nd intersecting line continue weaving these lines as you position the rest of the lines position the 1st chain of the second triangle over the 42nd chain re-insert your hook through both chain s and the st underneath pull a loop through all continue to round 5 special notes for chain hexagram gauge is so important for the chain if you find your gauge is too tight consider going up hook sizes until it s right alternatively if your gauge is too loose go down in hook size until it looks right be careful not to twist the chain as you pin it in place ©2024 christine anne melvin/womanwalkingawire 4 round 5 note as you work this round when you come to a st with a star point pinned in place work your st/sts through the top 2 loops of the chain & the st beneath working through both chain s and the st below chain 2 counts as 1st half_double_crochet 2 half_double_crochet into next st half_double_crochet next 5 x 7 2 half_double_crochet into next st
